get.summary: get production support sample by id

questions.label: What kind of video is this?
01. Is it a resolution other than 1920*1080?
02. Are they converted to FPS other than normal frame rates of 24, 30, and 60 FPS?
03. Is the image a vertical standard for mobile devices, not a typical 16:9, 21:9, etc., or a 4:3 ratio?
04. Is there any audio tear, unintended sound (space sound), reverberation, echo, etc. present?
05. Does the L/R balance constantly fail or one side fails?
06. Is the audio tone, intensity, and height unbalanced due to environmental noise or low sound quality?
07. Is the video intended to advocate for or intend discrimination or hate messages that can cause negative social controversy?
08. Has the cast/producer committed any crime in the last year?
09. Does the video show nude and abusive language without filtering and mosaic? Or is there any exposure to intrigue or conspiracy?
01. Does it fit the upload genre criteria?
02. Does it include subscriptions, likes, and logos?
03. Is there a lack of popularity, commerciality, or consideration, but only artistry is emphasized?
04. Does it include an intro?
05. Does the trailer include?
01. Production and context are consistently produced and expressed for the title, purpose, and theme of the program to ensure accurate and sufficient understanding of the program's purpose?

02. (if necessary) Does this program include reasons, evidence, supporting explanations, descriptions of data collection and analysis, author descriptions, literature exploration, visits to associations and government offices, expert advice and opinions, and hands-on experience?
03.Does [the performer = the main photographer] hinder completeness and workmanship suitable for the purpose of the program?
04. (if necessary) Does [the movement of the place] hinder completeness and workmanship suitable for the purpose of the program?
01. Is the video scenario, not story development, but only events or subheadings (clip vs. rounds)
02. Has the purpose of the program been realized by organizing the elementary, middle, and late stages of the program according to the progress?
03.Does the pre- and post-sequence and process skip to prevent understanding and lack of immersion through sudden composition and content development?
04. Are the objectives of each organization, not just a list of the sequence of progress, sufficient explanation, progress, and representation of the situation?
05. (if necessary) Is it possible to create a different configuration from the previous or later and cause confusion to the Subscriber or to organize the same program?
01. Is there any visual style or inconsistency, pixel break, distortion, etc. that is different from the pre- or post-production?
02. Is the image beauty suitable for the purpose of the program fully expressed by applying or without color grading to the visual style?
03. Did various inserts, close-ups, landscapes, and aerial shots use or not express enough visual style to fit the purpose of the program?
04. Is there any difference or comparison with existing works against the purpose of visual beauty pursued by the platform?
